metadata.title: CVE-2019-15681 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
LibVNC commit before d01e1bb4246323ba6fcee3b82ef1faa9b1dac82a contains amemory leak (CWE-655) in VNC server code, which allow an attacker to readstack memory and can be abused for information disclosure. Combined withanother vulnerability, it can be used to leak stack memory and bypass ASLR.This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. Thesevulnerabilities have been fixed in commitd01e1bb4246323ba6fcee3b82ef1faa9b1dac82a.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15681` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

vino - 3.22.0-3ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

italc-client - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2').
vino package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-3ubuntu1.1').
x11vnc package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
krfb package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
tightvnc package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
italc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.3+dfsg1-3ubuntu0.1').
